messages.title: Labour's Pledges to You
messages.content: A strong economic foundation, Higher living standards for working families, An NHS with the time to care, Controls on immigration, A country where the next generation can do better than the last.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Balance the books and cut the deficit every year while securing the future of the NHS.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Higher living standards for working families
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Freeze energy bills until 2017 and give the regulator the power to cut bills. Increase the minimum wage to £8, and provide 25 hours free childcare.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: An NHS with the time to care
keyPolicies.policyDescription: 20,000 more nurses and 8,000 more GPs. Guarantee GP appointments within 48 hours and cancer tests within one week.
People who come here won't be able to claim benefits for at least two years, and introduce rules making it illegal for employers to undercut wages by exploiting workers.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A country where the next generation can do better than the last
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Reduce tuition fees to £6,000, guarantee an apprenticeship for every school leaver who gets the basic grades, and ensure smaller classes for 5, 6, & 7 year-olds.

issues.economy: Balance the books and cut the deficit every year while securing the future of the NHS.
issues.education: Reduce tuition fees to £6,000, guarantee an apprenticeship for every school leaver who gets the basic grades, and ensure smaller classes for 5, 6, & 7 year-olds.
issues.health: 20,000 more nurses and 8,000 more GPs. Guarantee GP appointments within 48 hours and cancer tests within one week.
issues.immigration: People who come here won't be able to claim benefits for at least two years, and introduce rules making it illegal for employers to undercut wages by exploiting workers.

leaflet.personalStatement: "Labour's plan is based on one simple idea: that Britain only succeeds when working families succeed." - Ed Miliband

quotes.text: "Labour's plan is based on one simple idea: that Britain only succeeds when working families succeed."

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet mentions Labour's key policies and pledges, with a personal statement from Ed Miliband emphasizing the idea that Britain only succeeds when working families succeed.
